monthly_spend_analysis_data.ai_summary: In January 2023, your total income was $4,500, and your total spending was $2,030.41, which is 45.12% of your income. Your largest expense category was Rent & Utilities at $1,500 (33.33% of income). Food & Dining accounted for $191.50 (4.26% of income), Entertainment was $114.97 (2.56% of income), and Personal Care & Shopping was $224.98 (5% of income). To better manage your finances, consider reducing discretionary spending on entertainment, shopping, and dining out. Additionally, building an emergency fund should be a priority to prepare for unexpected expenses.

email_notifications.spending_summary_email: Your Monthly Financial Insights Are Ready!

email_notifications.credit_cards_email: Chase Sapphire: Earn 60K bonus points, 3X on dining
email_notifications.savings_email: Marcus 4.30% APY: Grow your emergency fund faster
email_notifications.coupons_email: John, listen up! I've got the BOGO deal of the century for you. Buy one electronic, get one free at Best Buy with code BOGO23TECH. This offer's hotter than a laptop on a summer day, so act fast before it expires 9/25!
email_notifications.loans_email: Yo John, I've got the 411 on a sweet personal loan deal from Chase. Score rates as low as 6.99% APR on $3K-$35K! With your good credit, this loan will have lower interest than your uncle's bad jokes. Apply now before they're all snatched up!
email_notifications.credit_cards_email: John, you sly dog! How'd you like $200 cash back just for using a new credit card? Citi's Double Cash card is offering a juicy welcome bonus after spending $1,500 in 6 months. It's like getting paid to spend money - the American dream!
email_notifications.savings_email: Listen up, John! I've found the holy grail of savings accounts for your emergency fund. Marcus by Goldman Sachs is offering a scorching 4.3% APY with no minimums or fees. It's like printing free money! Let's get that rainy day fund fattened up faster than your aunt's fruitcake.
